conbody.p: The Top Buckets widget displays the most active buckets with regards to Read and Write requests. Top buckets performance

The table contains the following information:
Bucket Name: the bucket name
Reads: percentage of Read requests on the bucket, as part of all Read requests in all buckets on the system.
Writes: percentage of Write requests in this bucket, as part of all Write requests in all buckets on the system.
Total: total percentage of combined Read and Write requests in this bucket, as part of all requests to other buckets on the system.
Average Response Time: average response time on the total of Read and Write requests over the set time period.
Date: end date of the requested date range for which you want to retrieve the top buckets information.

You can order the data in ascending or descending order per column. For example, if you wish to order the table by Write requests, click Writes in the header row of the table. This orders your table by Write requests in descending order. Click the header again to invert the order. The same applies to all other rows of the table.
